member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm
member.summary: Represents the abstract base class from which all implementations of asymmetric algorithms must inherit.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: The implementation of the derived class is not valid.

member.summary: Releases all resources used by the class.

member.summary: Creates a default cryptographic object used to perform the asymmetric algorithm.
member.returns: A new instance, unless the default settings have been changed with the <cryptoClass> element.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified implementation of an asymmetric algorithm.
member.param:
The asymmetric algorithm implementation to use. The following table shows the valid values for the parameter and the algorithms they map to. Parameter value
Implements
System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm
RSA
System.Security.Cryptography.RSA
DSA
System.Security.Cryptography.DSA
ECDsa
ECDsaCng
System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng
ECDH
ECDiffieHellman
ECDiffieHellmanCng
System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellmanCng
member.returns: A new instance of the specified asymmetric algorithm implementation.

A derived type has not overriden this member.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode
member.summary: Specifies the block cipher mode to use for encryption.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode.CBC
member.summary: The Cipher Block Chaining () mode introduces feedback. Before each plain text block is encrypted, it is combined with the cipher text of the previous block by a bitwise exclusive OR operation. This ensures that even if the plain text contains many identical blocks, they will each encrypt to a different cipher text block. The initialization vector is combined with the first plain text block by a bitwise exclusive OR operation before the block is encrypted. If a single bit of the cipher text block is mangled, the corresponding plain text block will also be mangled. In addition, a bit in the subsequent block, in the same position as the original mangled bit, will be mangled.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode.CFB
member.summary: The Cipher Feedback () mode processes small increments of plain text into cipher text, instead of processing an entire block at a time. This mode uses a shift register that is one block in length and is divided into sections. For example, if the block size is 8 bytes, with one byte processed at a time, the shift register is divided into eight sections. If a bit in the cipher text is mangled, one plain text bit is mangled and the shift register is corrupted. This results in the next several plain text increments being mangled until the bad bit is shifted out of the shift register. The default feedback size can vary by algorithm, but is typically either 8 bits or the number of bits of the block size. You can alter the number of feedback bits by using the property. Algorithms that support CFB use this property to set the feedback.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode.CTS
member.summary: The Cipher Text Stealing () mode handles any length of plain text and produces cipher text whose length matches the plain text length. This mode behaves like the mode for all but the last two blocks of the plain text.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode.ECB
member.summary: The Electronic Codebook () mode encrypts each block individually. Any blocks of plain text that are identical and in the same message, or that are in a different message encrypted with the same key, will be transformed into identical cipher text blocks. Important: This mode is not recommended because it opens the door for multiple security exploits. If the plain text to be encrypted contains substantial repetition, it is feasible for the cipher text to be broken one block at a time. It is also possible to use block analysis to determine the encryption key. Also, an active adversary can substitute and exchange individual blocks without detection, which allows blocks to be saved and inserted into the stream at other points without detection.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode.OFB
member.summary: The Output Feedback () mode processes small increments of plain text into cipher text instead of processing an entire block at a time. This mode is similar to ; the only difference between the two modes is the way that the shift register is filled. If a bit in the cipher text is mangled, the corresponding bit of plain text will be mangled. However, if there are extra or missing bits from the cipher text, the plain text will be mangled from that point on.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.PaddingMode
member.summary: Specifies the type of padding to apply when the message data block is shorter than the full number of bytes needed for a cryptographic operation.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PaddingMode.ANSIX923
member.summary: The ANSIX923 padding string consists of a sequence of bytes filled with zeros before the length.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PaddingMode.ISO10126
member.summary: The ISO10126 padding string consists of random data before the length.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PaddingMode.None
member.summary: No padding is done.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PaddingMode.PKCS7
member.summary: The PKCS #7 padding string consists of a sequence of bytes, each of which is equal to the total number of padding bytes added.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PaddingMode.Zeros
member.summary: The padding string consists of bytes set to zero.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.PbeEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies encryption algorithms to be used with Password-Based Encryption (PBE).

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PbeEncryptionAlgorithm.Aes128Cbc
member.summary: Indicates the encryption should be performed with the AES-128 algorithm in CBC mode with PKCS#7 padding.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PbeEncryptionAlgorithm.Aes192Cbc
member.summary: Indicates the encryption should be performed with the AES-192 algorithm in CBC mode with PKCS#7 padding.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PbeEncryptionAlgorithm.Aes256Cbc
member.summary: Indicates that encryption be performed with the AES-256 algorithm in CBC mode with PKCS#7 padding.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PbeEncryptionAlgorithm.TripleDes3KeyPkcs12
member.summary: Indicates the encryption should be performed with the TripleDES algorithm in CBC mode with a 192-bit key derived using the Key Derivation Function (KDF) from PKCS#12.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.PbeEncryptionAlgorithm.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates that no encryption algorithm has been selected.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.PbeParameters
member.summary: Represents parameters to be used for Password-Based Encryption (PBE).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The algorithm to use when encrypting data.
The name of a hash algorithm to use with the Key Derivation Function (KDF) to turn a password into an encryption key.
The iteration count to provide to the Key Derivation Function (KDF) to turn a password into an encryption key.
member.exception: is less than 1.

member.summary: Gets the algorithm to use when encrypting data.
member.returns: The algorithm to use when encrypting data.
